andi 1/23/2022 9:23 PM
or maybe work without nickel...
tux-linux 1/23/2022 9:23 PM
Hello, what do you mean exactly?
andi 1/23/2022 9:25 PM
well, I am not that into inkbox yet, so nickel is just used to display something?
9:25 PM
never hacked in the original system too much
tux-linux 1/23/2022 9:25 PM
Nickel is the Kobo firmware, specifically, the binary which manages the default UI on a Kobo
andi 1/23/2022 9:26 PM
ok, you call the whole firmware nickel and not just that binary
9:26 PM
so inkbox depends on that UI being there?
tux-linux 1/23/2022 9:27 PM
...yeah It's not the best to do, but when we refer to Nickel we often refer to the Kobo firmware
9:27 PM
No, InkBox is completely different from Nickel
9:27 PM
No parts of the original firmware are there when InkBox runs on a Kobo
9:27 PM
It's a complete, self-managed OS
andi 1/23/2022 9:28 PM
oh, I see
1
tux-linux 1/23/2022 9:28 PM
For example, here's the rootfs https://github.com/Kobo-InkBox/rootfs
andi 1/23/2022 9:30 PM
so I could just put that rootfs on an empty partition and then manage to boot into that partition, inkbox should work?
tux-linux 1/23/2022 9:30 PM
nope
9:30 PM
It's complicated
9:31 PM
See scripts here https://github.com/Kobo-InkBox/kernel/tree/master/initrd/common To see how InkBox is started
9:31 PM
I suggest you start with rcS-std
andi 1/23/2022 9:41 PM
ok, a lot of hard coded partition numbers, and the kernel area is touched for updating, so at least that script has to be modified for that task
9:43 PM
so I need the inkbox initramfs to be loaded besides the kernel. But that just simply can live in /boot of that partition
tux-linux 1/23/2022 9:47 PM
The initramfs usually is embedded in the kernel to make things simpler
andi 1/23/2022 9:56 PM
probably a matter of taste if that is simpler or not
9:56 PM
BTW UR=3 for the Clara HD
9:57 PM
in that script
tux-linux 1/23/2022 9:57 PM
Well, it was simpler for me
9:57 PM
Ok got it, so the screen is upright when rotate is set to 3?
andi 1/23/2022 9:57 PM

andi 1/23/2022 11:08 PM
something else about rotating: Touchscreen input needs to be rotated, too, if that UR=3 is applied.
11:09 PM
$ cat /etc/X11/xorg.conf.d/touch.conf Section "InputClass" Identifier "cyttsp5_mt" MatchProduct "cyttsp5_mt" Driver "evdev" Option "CalibrationMatrix" "0 -1 1 1 0 0 0 0 1" Option "SwapAxes" "1" Option "InvertX" "1" EndSection Section "InputClass" Identifier "cyttsp5" MatchProduct "cyttsp5" Driver "evdev" Option "CalibrationMatrix" "0 -1 1 1 0 0 0 0 1" Option "SwapAxes" "1" Option "InvertX" "1" EndSection
11:09 PM
I have that
tux-linux 1/23/2022 11:10 PM
Where on Earth did you find that file?
andi 1/23/2022 11:11 PM
I myself created that on my debian installation to make things work
tux-linux 1/23/2022 11:11 PM
Oh
andi 1/23/2022 11:11 PM
I am running debian+matchbox+fbpanel
tux-linux 1/23/2022 11:11 PM
Well input usually is handled by Qt
andi 1/23/2022 11:12 PM
on top of X
tux-linux 1/23/2022 11:12 PM
There's Qt VNC viewer that connects to x11vnc and sends touch events to X
andi 1/23/2022 11:12 PM
well, yes, but I guess things have to be set up there correctly, too
tux-linux 1/23/2022 11:12 PM
Because touch input works well in Qt
11:12 PM
It's the koboplatformplugin
11:13 PM
See etc/init.d/xorg.sh script in rootfs
andi 1/23/2022 11:24 PM
oh, I remember, there were some troubles with the vender 4.1.15 and using Xorg directly. But that got better with newer kernels. All I wanted to say is that touchscreen input has to be rotated the same way as the display. It is different on the Tolino Shine 2 HD, there only the framebuffer needs to be rotated, but not the input.
11:26 PM
and that probably has to be configured somewhere.
11:28 PM
I am not going to judge about anything in your userspace that quickly without having studied it intensively.
11:28 PM
so, now it is time to sleep here
1

tux-linux 1/24/2022 11:51 PM

tux-linux changed the channel name: Kobo Clara HD (N249) 1/25/2022 7:35 PM
phodina 2/5/2022 7:28 PM
Hi guys, is there something I can help with? I do have Kobo Clara HD as specified in this thread https://github.com/Kobo-InkBox/inkbox/issues/4
Kobo Clara HD · Issue #4 · Kobo-InkBox/inkbox
Hi, does Inkbox run on Kobo Clara HD EInk reader?
tux-linux 2/5/2022 7:32 PM
Yep! Currently busy but later today I'll provide you some test instructions
phodina 2/5/2022 7:33 PM
Great!
tux-linux 2/6/2022 4:33 AM
Ok, so first you should make a clean partition layout on your card
4:35 AM
Make a backup of its current state (e.g. sudo dd if=/dev/mmcblk0 status=progress | xz > clarahd-backup.img.xz, then apply the following partition layout: Disk /dev/nbd0: 4 GiB, 4294967296 bytes, 8388608 sectors Units: sectors of 1 * 512 = 512 bytes Sector size (logical/physical): 512 bytes / 512 bytes I/O size (minimum/optimal): 512 bytes / 512 bytes Disklabel type: dos Disk identifier: 0x25c915c4 Device Boot Start End Sectors Size Id Type /dev/nbd0p1 40959 79871 38913 19M 83 Linux /dev/nbd0p2 104448 1128447 1024000 500M 83 Linux /dev/nbd0p3 1128448 1390591 262144 128M 83 Linux /dev/nbd0p4 1390592 8388607 6998016 3.3G 83 Linux (edited)
4:35 AM
Here, nbd0 should be replaced with your SD card's device node
4:36 AM
You can do this with fdisk on Linux
4:36 AM
Follow the "Start" and "End" columns closely (they're the sectors at which the partitions start & end)
4:36 AM
Feel free to ask if you need any help!
tux-linux
Make a backup of its current state (e.g. sudo dd if=/dev/mmcblk0 status=progress | xz > clarahd-backup.img.xz, then apply the following partition layout: Disk /dev/nbd0: 4 GiB, 4294967296 bytes, 8388608 sectors Units: sectors of 1 * 512 = 512 bytes Sector size (logical/physical): 512 bytes / 512 bytes I/O size (minimum/optimal): 512 bytes / 512 bytes Disklabel type: dos Disk identifier: 0x25c915c4 Device Boot Start End Sectors Size Id Type /dev/nbd0p1 40959 79871 38913 19M 83 Linux /dev/nbd0p2 104448 1128447 1024000 500M 83 Linux /dev/nbd0p3 1128448 1390591 262144 128M 83 Linux /dev/nbd0p4 1390592 8388607 6998016 3.3G 83 Linux (edited)
tux-linux 2/6/2022 5:25 AM
Actually, before doing that, what's fdisk -l on your SD card?
phodina 2/6/2022 1:48 PM
Hi, the partition layout of the unaltered firmware is following: Disk kobo_clara_hd.image: 7.4 GiB, 7948206080 bytes, 15523840 sectors Units: sectors of 1 * 512 = 512 bytes Sector size (logical/physical): 512 bytes / 512 bytes I/O size (minimum/optimal): 512 bytes / 512 bytes Disklabel type: dos Disk identifier: 0x3b3b90d1 Device Boot Start End Sectors Size Id Type kobo_clara_hd.image1 49152 573440 524289 256M 83 Linux kobo_clara_hd.image2 573441 1097729 524289 256M 83 Linux kobo_clara_hd.image3 1097730 15456254 14358525 6.8G b W95 F
1:50 PM
I'll make the layout later today. Could you please label the partitions to understand their purpose?
tux-linux 2/6/2022 3:51 PM
Yeah, I usually label them on factory images releases. P1 is "boot", contains flags P2 is "recoveryfs", contains recovery filesystem archive P3 is "rootfs", contains root filesystem archive P4 is "user", contains all user data You can use e2label to label them (edited)
phodina
Hi, the partition layout of the unaltered firmware is following: Disk kobo_clara_hd.image: 7.4 GiB, 7948206080 bytes, 15523840 sectors Units: sectors of 1 * 512 = 512 bytes Sector size (logical/physical): 512 bytes / 512 bytes I/O size (minimum/optimal): 512 bytes / 512 bytes Disklabel type: dos Disk identifier: 0x3b3b90d1 Device Boot Start End Sectors Size Id Type kobo_clara_hd.image1 49152 573440 524289 256M 83 Linux kobo_clara_hd.image2 573441 1097729 524289 256M 83 Linux kobo_clara_hd.image3 1097730 15456254 14358525 6.8G b W95 F
tux-linux 2/6/2022 3:52 PM
Ok thanks, replace the first partition start sector with 49152 in the layout I sent. The rest still holds up (edited)

9:46 PM

andi

tux-linux 2/18/2022 7:19 AM
I think I'll go with the waveform he provides in the unpartitioned space, and put it in /lib/epdc.fw then boot your kernel. If it is unique to each device, well there must be some similar things too. I wouldn't expect one to not work at all... Also, I distribute my InkBox images which already contain a full SD image with waveform among other things, and it works for people, so I guess, as you said, that it should work there too.
andi 2/18/2022 8:53 AM

8:54 AM

daad0e579ab252e69633af72b2a6c57066a7501b7a32eebb43c215588d7c8e9f

andi 2/18/2022 1:17 PM

1
1:18 PM
and Kobo Libra has the same one of the Kobo Clara backups (edited)
andi 2/18/2022 1:36 PM
and btw: waveform for the Shine 3 (=Kobo Clara with i.IMX6SL instead of 6SLL) is different, and it seems not to be interchangeable at all. Perhaps some magic settings in the EPDC
1

andi 2/18/2022 1:37 PM

tux-linux 4/28/2022 4:06 AM
I'm setting up the core part currently, waiting from advice from andi1 about which U-Boot to use in InkBox OS (sent him an email, easier to find info back there afterwards) Kernel compiles fine, good thing (edited)
1
tux-linux 5/1/2022 6:38 AM
I'll add U-Boot 2020.10 (from andi1's tree) to the repo, will give you instructions when done
tux-linux 5/1/2022 3:56 PM
@alex(O_o) , please clone InkBox kernel repo: sudo mkdir -p /home/build/inkbox && sudo chown -R "${USER}:${USER}" /home/build/ && cd /home/build/inkbox git clone https://github.com/Kobo-InkBox/kernel && sync Then, compile U-Boot (bootloader) and kernel with the following commands: cd /home/build/inkbox/kernel env TOOLCHAINDIR=/home/build/inkbox/kernel/toolchain/arm-kobo-linux-gnueabihf TARGET=arm-kobo-linux-gnueabihf THREADS=8 scripts/build_u-boot.sh n249 env GITDIR=/home/build/inkbox/kernel TOOLCHAINDIR=/home/build/inkbox/kernel/toolchain/armv7l-linux-musleabihf-cross/ THREADS=8 TARGET=armv7l-linux-musleabihf scripts/build_kernel.sh n249 root After that, you should have the two following files available: bootloader/out/u-boot_inkbox.n249.imx kernel/out/n249/zImage-root Tell me when you are done (edited)
alex(O_o) 5/1/2022 8:21 PM
THREADS=8 is for 8 cpu threads ?
Szybet 5/1/2022 8:24 PM
yes
alex(O_o) 5/1/2022 8:26 PM
I only have 4 threads, so I can change it to 4
tux-linux 5/1/2022 8:31 PM
You can keep 8, it isn't dependent on your processor cores number
alex(O_o) 5/1/2022 8:35 PM
okay
8:36 PM
what does it do ?
Szybet 5/1/2022 8:37 PM
you mean the commands?
alex(O_o) 5/1/2022 8:37 PM
THREADS=8
Szybet 5/1/2022 8:37 PM
specifies how many cores are used for compiling
8:37 PM
becouse the default is 1
8:37 PM
if its above your count it will use all of them
alex(O_o) 5/1/2022 8:38 PM
okayyy
Szybet
specifies how many cores are used for compiling
tux-linux 5/1/2022 8:39 PM

tux-linux 5/1/2022 8:40 PM

8:41 PM

tux-linux

tux-linux 5/1/2022 8:42 PM

Szybet 5/1/2022 8:42 PM
then 4 jobs will have max performance, or 8 jobs will have 50% performance
8:43 PM

alex(O_o) 5/2/2022 3:01 AM
Disk /dev/sda: 7,4 GiB, 7948206080 bytes, 15523840 sectors Disk model: SD/MMC Units: sectors of 1 * 512 = 512 bytes Sector size (logical/physical): 512 bytes / 512 bytes I/O size (minimum/optimal): 512 bytes / 512 bytes Disklabel type: dos Disk identifier: 0xf9e82d0e Device Boot Start End Sectors Size Id Type /dev/sda1 49152 79872 30721 15M 83 Linux /dev/sda2 104448 1128447 1024000 500M 83 Linux /dev/sda3 1128448 1390591 262144 128M 83 Linux /dev/sda4 1390592 15523839 14133248 6,7G 83 Linux
tux-linux 5/2/2022 3:02 AM
ok, awesome
alex(O_o) 5/2/2022 3:03 AM
why do we need to change the partition layout ?
tux-linux 5/2/2022 3:04 AM
there are 4 partitions instead of three and inkbox os writes some things in the unpartitioned space between some partitions
3:05 AM
now, please dd if=/dev/mmcblk0 bs=512 count=49151 of=bootmmc.bin xz bootmmc.bin and share bootmmc.bin.xz via PM
3:06 AM
if you want more privacy, you can blank out the serial number (but your clara is likely already out of warranty) by doing so dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/mmcblk0 bs=256 seek=2 count=1
tux-linux
now, please dd if=/dev/mmcblk0 bs=512 count=49151 of=bootmmc.bin xz bootmmc.bin and share bootmmc.bin.xz via PM
tux-linux 5/2/2022 3:07 AM
then do this
tux-linux 5/2/2022 3:15 AM
now, please mkfs.ext4 /dev/mmcblk0p1 -O "^metadata_csum" and do the same for p2, p3 and p4
alex(O_o) 5/2/2022 3:18 AM
done
tux-linux 5/2/2022 3:21 AM
now we will generate the public/private key pair that will be used to sign release InkBox OS packages on this device. you have to promise me that you will never share it with anyone. only me and you will know what the private key is. please do: openssl genrsa -out private.pem 2048 openssl rsa -in private.pem -out public.pem -outform PEM -pubout and send both public.pem and private.pem via PM
alex(O_o) 5/2/2022 3:22 AM
you/me + discord
tux-linux 5/2/2022 3:22 AM
well, discord probably doesn't care about this
alex(O_o) 5/2/2022 3:23 AM
sure
tux-linux 5/2/2022 3:23 AM
otherwise you can send it via email kobox.alpine@gmail.com
alex(O_o) 5/2/2022 3:29 AM
why do I also need to know the private key ?
tux-linux 5/2/2022 3:29 AM
because it will be easier for you to sign packages while testing
3:29 AM
otherwise it can be a pain
alex(O_o) 5/2/2022 3:30 AM
okay, I'll have to compile stuff and then sign the pkg ?
tux-linux 5/2/2022 3:30 AM
yes
3:31 AM
or it won't allow to run it on the device
3:32 AM
ok, now: cd /home/build/inkbox git clone https://github.com/Kobo-InkBox/rootfs && cd rootfs env GITDIR="${PWD}" ./release.sh && cd .. openssl dgst -sha256 -sign /path/to/private.pem -out rootfs.squashfs.dgst rootfs.squashfs then, copy rootfs.squashfs* in p3
alex(O_o) 5/2/2022 3:38 AM
done
tux-linux 5/2/2022 3:40 AM

3:40 AM
copy overlaymount-rootfs.squashfs* in p3 AND p2

tux-linux 6/29/2022 1:53 PM
1. Use scp, much simpler scp epdc.fw pi@192.168.1.x:/tmp 2. mkdir -p /lib/firmware; busybox rx /lib/firmware/epdc.fw on the Kobo 3. on the rpi, Ctrl-A + S, then select xmodem and follow the instructions

5:03 PM
struct mxcfb_update_data upd_region; memset(&upd_region, 0, sizeof(upd_region)); upd_region.update_region.left = x; upd_region.update_region.top = y; upd_region.update_region.width = w; upd_region.update_region.height = h; upd_region.waveform_mode = WAVEFORM_MODE_AUTO; upd_region.temp = TEMP_USE_AMBIENT; upd_region.update_mode = UPDATE_MODE_PARTIAL; upd_region.flags = 0; ret = ioctl(fd, MXCFB_SEND_UPDATE, &upd_region);
5:04 PM
that works here
andi 7/3/2022 5:11 PM

5:12 PM

linux/mxcfb.h at kobo/merged-5.16 · akemnade/linux
Linux kernel source tree. Contribute to akemnade/linux development by creating an account on GitHub.
5:12 PM

andi 8/25/2022 4:15 PM
what can happen here is that fbink is using some special kobo/netronix ioctl stuff which is not included in Freescale/NXP kernels.
4:16 PM
Freescale/NXP kernels already contain things to refresh the display
tux-linux 8/25/2022 4:18 PM
Then what to do? (edited)
andi 8/25/2022 4:25 PM

4:26 PM

andi 8/25/2022 4:58 PM

5.83 KB

5:00 PM

5:00 PM

tux-linux 8/25/2022 5:01 PM
Maybe you can try using InkBox kernel?
tux-linux
@alex(O_o) , please clone InkBox kernel repo: sudo mkdir -p /home/build/inkbox && sudo chown -R "${USER}:${USER}" /home/build/ && cd /home/build/inkbox git clone https://github.com/Kobo-InkBox/kernel && sync Then, compile U-Boot (bootloader) and kernel with the following commands: cd /home/build/inkbox/kernel env TOOLCHAINDIR=/home/build/inkbox/kernel/toolchain/arm-kobo-linux-gnueabihf TARGET=arm-kobo-linux-gnueabihf THREADS=8 scripts/build_u-boot.sh n249 env GITDIR=/home/build/inkbox/kernel TOOLCHAINDIR=/home/build/inkbox/kernel/toolchain/armv7l-linux-musleabihf-cross/ THREADS=8 TARGET=armv7l-linux-musleabihf scripts/build_kernel.sh n249 root After that, you should have the two following files available: bootloader/out/u-boot_inkbox.n249.imx kernel/out/n249/zImage-root Tell me when you are done (edited)
tux-linux 8/25/2022 5:03 PM
.

Szybet 8/27/2022 3:58 PM
could this kernel run on other devices?
andi 8/27/2022 3:59 PM
yes
4:01 PM
The drm version of it (which contains a epdc driver which does use standard kernel interfaces for refreshing) is used in pmOS for several devices (the Kobo Clara HD, Tolino Shine 2HD (=Kobo Glo HD with some more buttons), Tolino 3 (=Kobo Clara HD with imx6sl instead of 6sll)
4:01 PM
the non-drm version also runs on these devices
4:03 PM
only FBInk has to be teached to look at /sys/firmware/devicetree/base/compatible first before deciding what refresh command to use (edited)
tux-linux 8/27/2022 4:05 PM

NiLuJe 8/27/2022 6:18 PM
Better: drop the refreshes in the two draw calls, and keep the final full-screen one
1
6:18 PM
(-b in the two draw calls, and drop the refresh related stuff from that because it becomes meaningless)
6:20 PM
fbink -qbhk into fbink -t blah bloop -qbmMh into fbink -qfws (edited)
6:23 PM
(I've finished reordering flags now, promise ;p)
6:24 PM
(k and s need to come last because getsubopt)
6:27 PM
Even better: drop the dedicated clear, because it's useless if you draw something later
6:27 PM
Just pop a -c in the first draw
6:27 PM
fbink -t blah bloop -qbcmMh into fbink -qfws
6:28 PM
I imagine whatever print_qr does needs the same tweak (-b) to drop its refresh (edited)
6:28 PM
(I, err, feel like I already explained that at least 3 times, oh, well :D)

tux-linux 9/3/2022 9:40 PM
actually doesn't fit the definition https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Embedded_system
Embedded system
An embedded system is a computer system—a combination of a computer processor, computer memory, and input/output peripheral devices—that has a dedicated function within a larger mechanical or electronic system. It is embedded as part of a complete device often including electrical or electronic hardware and mechanical parts. Because an embedded...

andi 11/22/2022 8:21 PM
well, we have a well-behaved u-boot, so several options:
8:22 PM
if there is no kernel on the disk, it will fallback to fastboot, we can put it together with mkbootimage into one thing
8:22 PM
for later, put it somewhere, preferrably on the boot partition
8:23 PM
and also the zImage
8:23 PM
tell the u-boot to load both
Szybet 11/22/2022 8:23 PM
it is diffrent from regular kobo kernels right?
8:23 PM
this process
andi 11/22/2022 8:24 PM
the difference is that a) uboot does not use the hidden partitions by default
8:24 PM
b) we need to have u-boot configured
8:25 PM
add commands to boot
8:25 PM
into its environment
8:25 PM
and devicetree is different/incompatible
8:25 PM
kobo 4.1.15 kernels need also devicetrees
Szybet 11/22/2022 8:26 PM
well will you guide atro into doing that? i dont have any experience with this
andi 11/22/2022 8:26 PM

Anything you want except nickel, I guess?
6:43 PM
e.g., https://github.com/koreader/koxtoolchain kobo or kobomk7 would do (edited)
GitHub - koreader/koxtoolchain: Build script for various toolchains...
Build script for various toolchains used by KOReader - GitHub - koreader/koxtoolchain: Build script for various toolchains used by KOReader
6:44 PM
Although you could admittedly use a custom one built against an even more recent glibc (and/or possibly kernel, depending) for inkbox, I guess (edited)
6:46 PM
Or musl, even? can't remember where you guys use glibc or not
6:46 PM
In any case, the libc is irrelevant for a kernel build
6:47 PM
so, TL;DR: kobomk7
6:47 PM
or kobo if you want more portable binaries
NiLuJe
Or musl, even? can't remember where you guys use glibc or not

Szybet 12/12/2022 11:21 PM
i define
NiLuJe 12/13/2022 2:01 AM
That's not the kobo variant
2:01 AM
That's the nickel one
2:02 AM
Which nobody in their right mind should be using, ever
2:02 AM
It's only there for Nickel* addons
2:03 AM
(and possibly building 2.x kernels without jumping through extra hoops, or to keep compatibility with vendor kernels when building modules)
atro

alex(O_o) 12/13/2022 8:10 AM

8:25 AM

8:25 AM
musl
tux-linux
@alex(O_o) , please clone InkBox kernel repo: sudo mkdir -p /home/build/inkbox && sudo chown -R "${USER}:${USER}" /home/build/ && cd /home/build/inkbox git clone https://github.com/Kobo-InkBox/kernel && sync Then, compile U-Boot (bootloader) and kernel with the following commands: cd /home/build/inkbox/kernel env TOOLCHAINDIR=/home/build/inkbox/kernel/toolchain/arm-kobo-linux-gnueabihf TARGET=arm-kobo-linux-gnueabihf THREADS=8 scripts/build_u-boot.sh n249 env GITDIR=/home/build/inkbox/kernel TOOLCHAINDIR=/home/build/inkbox/kernel/toolchain/armv7l-linux-musleabihf-cross/ THREADS=8 TARGET=armv7l-linux-musleabihf scripts/build_kernel.sh n249 root After that, you should have the two following files available: bootloader/out/u-boot_inkbox.n249.imx kernel/out/n249/zImage-root Tell me when you are done (edited)
atro 12/17/2022 11:56 AM

11:57 AM

atro 12/17/2022 6:45 PM
@Szybet I'm still missing the squash part because I need to remember what I did last time. I think that I should create the keys first, then move the public one in the kernel's initrd, then compile the kernel, then sign the rootfs with the same key that I moved into the kernel, right?
6:45 PM
https://github.com/aartoni/n249
1
Szybet 12/17/2022 6:47 PM
no, let me explain how openssl key work
6:48 PM
the public ones can verify if files signed by those private keys are valid
6:48 PM
so you sign everything with private keys, and move the public ones into the kernel
atro
https://github.com/aartoni/n249
Szybet 12/17/2022 6:48 PM
very cool guide
1
atro 12/17/2022 7:46 PM
You're right, I typed it wrong, so basically the same but sign with the private one, right?
Szybet 12/17/2022 7:47 PM
1. You put public keys into the kernel 2. You sign with the pair - private key the rootfs
7:47 PM
thats it
atro 12/17/2022 7:48 PM
Nice, I'll update the guide tomorrow

Szybet 12/18/2022 7:43 PM
sd card
atro 12/18/2022 7:44 PM

Szybet 12/18/2022 7:44 PM
7:44 PM
my laptop example
7:45 PM
sda means the whole disk, sda1 means the first partition
7:45 PM

alex(O_o)

Szybet 12/28/2022 5:38 PM
it unpacks fbink
alex(O_o) 12/28/2022 5:39 PM
cleanup() { umount "${CHROOT_DIR}/dev" -l -f &>/dev/null umount "${CHROOT_DIR}/sys" -l -f &>/dev/null umount "${CHROOT_DIR}/proc" -l -f &>/dev/null rm -rf "${CHROOT_DIR}" &>/dev/null }
5:40 PM
maybe this remove /splash after /etc/init.d/inkbox-splash has been executed ?
Szybet 12/28/2022 5:41 PM

5:41 PM
kind off
5:41 PM

alex(O_o) 12/28/2022 5:41 PM
done
5:42 PM
maybe i also need to mount some stuff to use something else than fbink --help
Szybet 12/28/2022 5:42 PM
something else doesnt work?
alex(O_o) 12/28/2022 5:44 PM
after mounting it seems to work
5:44 PM
mount -t devtmpfs devtmpfs "/splaash/dev" && mount -t sysfs sysfs "/splaash/sys" && mount -t proc proc "/splaash/proc" like in the script
5:44 PM
then LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/opt/fbink busybox chroot /splaash/ /opt/fbink/fbink -x 1 -y 10 "Hello World!"
5:45 PM
[FBInk] Couldn't find a Kobo version tag (onboard unmounted or not running on a Kobo?)! [FBInk] Detected a Kobo Clara HD (376 => Nova @ Mark 7) [FBInk] Enabled Kobo Mark 7 quirks [FBInk] Clock tick frequency appears to be 100 Hz [FBInk] Screen density set to 300 dpi [FBInk] Variable fb info: 1072x1448, 16bpp @ rotation: 3 (Counter Clockwise, 270°) [FBInk] Fixed fb info: ID is "mxc_epdc_fb", length of fb mem: 6782976 bytes & line length: 2176 bytes [FBInk] Canonical rotation: 0 (Upright, 0°) [FBInk] Fontsize set to 24x24 (IBM base glyph size: 8x8) [FBInk] Line length: 44 cols, Page size: 60 rows [FBInk] Vertical fit isn't perfect, shifting rows down by 4 pixels [FBInk] Pen colors set to #000000 for the foreground and #FFFFFF for the background Printing string 'Hello World!' @ column 1 + 0px, row 10 + 0px (overlay: N, no BG: N, no FG: N, inverted) Next line should start @ row 11

Szybet 12/29/2022 1:21 PM
yea i mean using those patches and applying them ( rewriting ) for the clara
1:21 PM
inkbox os init is a replacement for the current init
andi 12/29/2022 1:39 PM
load_ntxkernel is a special kobo invention
1:39 PM
we are using a near-mainline u-boot
1:39 PM
so we use load mmc 0:x ${loadaddr} /kernel
1:39 PM
to load the kernel
1:39 PM
e.g.
1:41 PM
load mmc 0:x ${fdt_addr_r} /path/to/imx6sll-kobo-clarahd.dtb
1:42 PM
load mmc 0:x ${loadaddr} /zImage
1:43 PM
setenv bootargs root=/dev/mmcblk0pX console=ttymxc0,115200
1:43 PM
bootz ${loadaddr} - ${fdt_addr_r}
1:43 PM
that is basically the mainline u-boot game
1:44 PM
and of course, you do not want to type that in every now and then
1:45 PM
so do some setenv bootcmd load mmc ... ; load mmc ... ; setenv bootargs ...; bootz ${loadaddr} - ${fdt_addr_r}
1:46 PM
and saveenv
1:46 PM
and them it should boot automatically
1:46 PM
the next time
andi 12/29/2022 2:08 PM
of course that can be automated
2:10 PM
for how to do that, simply look at the device-tolino-shine2hd package
2:10 PM
of pmOS
2:10 PM
that is the most simpliest solution
2:10 PM
there I create a boot.scr in /boot/
andi 12/29/2022 2:22 PM
or more precise in the first partition
2:24 PM
https://gitlab.com/postmarketOS/pmaports/-/blob/master/device/testing/device-tolino-shine2hd/uboot-script.cmd
device/testing/device-tolino-shine2hd/uboot-script.cmd · master · p...
postmarketOS package build recipes
2:25 PM
mkimage -A arm -O linux -T script -n postmarketOS \ -d "$srcdir/uboot-script.cmd" "$srcdir/boot.scr"
alex(O_o) 12/29/2022 2:30 PM
i can remove the lines that tells to load the initrd ?
andi 12/29/2022 2:31 PM
if the initrd is not loaded or included in the kernel, yes
alex(O_o) 12/29/2022 2:31 PM
im not sure but i think it built into the kernel
andi 12/29/2022 2:32 PM
bootz .... 0x85000000 ...
alex(O_o)
im not sure but i think it built into the kernel
Szybet 12/29/2022 2:32 PM
its one file, so yes its built in
andi 12/29/2022 2:32 PM
that has to be bootz 0x80800000 - 0x83000000 (edited)
2:34 PM
loading such a script in u-boot to test:
2:35 PM
load mmc 0:1 ${loadaddr} /boot.scr
2:35 PM
source ${loadaddr}
alex(O_o) 12/29/2022 2:40 PM
nice it's working
2:40 PM
is it possible to load the kernel directly without having to type ? load mmc 0:1 ${loadaddr} /boot.scr source ${loadaddr}
andi 12/29/2022 2:41 PM
it should do
2:41 PM
if you just reboot
alex(O_o) 12/29/2022 2:42 PM
is it normal that reboot/poweroff commands do nothing in shell (with auto-boot interrupted)
andi 12/29/2022 2:43 PM
I think for poweroff there is a driver required which is not included for the PMIC
2:44 PM
reset might work
2:44 PM
we are talking about u-boot shell?
alex(O_o) 12/29/2022 2:44 PM
nop
andi 12/29/2022 2:44 PM
or linux shell
alex(O_o) 12/29/2022 2:44 PM
after kernel is loaded but init is interrupted
andi 12/29/2022 2:45 PM
for linux shell: these commands interact with the init system
2:45 PM
and do not poweroff/reboot themselves
2:45 PM
you can do echo -n u >/proc/sysrq-trigger ; echo -n b >/proc/sysrq-trigger
2:46 PM
to reboot
alex(O_o) 12/29/2022 2:47 PM
after a reboot im still welcomed with Unknown command 'load_ntxkernel' - try 'help
andi 12/29/2022 2:48 PM
type print
2:49 PM
the ugly way for now:
alex(O_o) 12/29/2022 2:49 PM
baudrate=115200 bootcmd=mmc dev ${mmcdev};if run loadimage; then run mmcboot; fi; bootcmd_mfg=run mfgtool_args;bootz ${loadaddr} ${initrd_addr} ${fdt_addr}; bootdelay=1 bootscript=echo Running bootscript from mmc ...; source console=ttymxc0 epdc_waveform=epdc_splash.bin fastboot_dev=mmc0 fdt_addr=0x83000000 fdt_file=undefined fdt_high=0xffffffff fdtcontroladdr=9ef9ab30 image=zImage initrd_addr=0x83800000 initrd_high=0xffffffff ip_dyn=yes loadaddr=0x80800000 loadbootscript=fatload mmc ${mmcdev}:${mmcpart} ${loadaddr} ${script}; loadfdt=load_ntxdtb loadimage=load_ntxkernel mfgtool_args=setenv bootargs console=${console},${baudrate} rdinit=/linuxrc g_mass_storage.stall=0 g_ma mmcargs=setenv bootargs console=${console},${baudrate} rootwait rw no_console_suspend mmcautodetect=no mmcboot=echo Booting from mmc ...; run mmcargs; if run loadfdt; then bootz ${loadaddr} - ${fdt_addr}; e; mmcdev=0 mmcpart=1 script=boot.scr stderr=serial stdin=serial stdout=serial Environment size: 1169/8188 bytes
andi 12/29/2022 2:49 PM
so, you can either kill the environment
2:49 PM
or modify it
andi
so do some setenv bootcmd load mmc ... ; load mmc ... ; setenv bootargs ...; bootz ${loadaddr} - ${fdt_addr_r}
alex(O_o) 12/29/2022 2:49 PM
like this ?
andi 12/29/2022 2:50 PM
setenv bootcmd load mmc 0:1 ${loadaddr} /boot.scr \; source ${loadaddr} (edited)
2:50 PM
saveenv
2:51 PM
hmm, discord eats \
alex(O_o) 12/29/2022 2:52 PM
nice it's working
andi

Szybet 12/29/2022 2:53 PM

7:01 PM
https://gitlab.com/postmarketOS/pmaports/-/blob/f046cd5d1b8e5da6c25d712ac4d99b6cd6248e8d/device/testing/u-boot-kobo-librah2o/u-boot-env.txt

postmarketOS package build recipes
7:01 PM
tools/mkenvimage -p 0 -s 8192 -o u-boot-env.bin "$srcdir/u-boot-env.txt"
7:02 PM
mkenvimage is often available in u-boot tools
7:04 PM
which is then copied to sector 1536
7:05 PM
dd if=u-boot-env.bin bs=512 seek=1536 of=/dev/sdX

// Kobo Clara HD (N249) specific stuff if(strstr(device, "n249")) { // Unsquashing modules { const char * arguments[] = { "/usr/bin/unsquashfs", "-d", "/lib/modules", "/opt/modules.sqsh", NULL }; run_command("/usr/bin/unsquashfs", arguments, true); } // Put epdc.fw in the right place mkpath("/lib/firmware/imx/epdc", 0755); mount("/opt/firmware.sqsh", "/lib/firmware/imx/epdc", "squashfs", 0, ""); // Load some modules load_module("/lib/modules/5.16.0/kernel/drivers/hwmon/tps6518x-hwmon.ko", ""); load_module("/lib/modules/5.16.0/kernel/drivers/regulator/tps6518x-regulator.ko", ""); load_module("/lib/modules/5.16.0/kernel/drivers/video/fbdev/mxc/mxc_epdc_v2_fb.ko", ""); }

if [ "${DEVICE}" == "n249" ]; then + unsquashfs -d /lib/modules /opt/modules.sqsh + # no support for xz in unsquashfs + mkdir -p /lib/firmware/imx/epdc + mount /opt/firmware.sqsh /lib/firmware/imx/epdc + find /sys/devices -name modalias -type f -print0 | xargs -0 sort -u | while read mod ; do modprobe $mod ; done +fi

// Kobo Clara HD (N249) specific stuff if(strstr(device, "n249")) { // Unsquashing modules { const char * arguments[] = { "/usr/bin/unsquashfs", "-d", "/lib/modules", "/opt/modules.sqsh", NULL }; run_command("/usr/bin/unsquashfs", arguments, true); } // Put epdc.fw in the right place mkpath("/lib/firmware/imx/epdc", 0755); mount("/opt/firmware.sqsh", "/lib/firmware/imx/epdc", "squashfs", 0, ""); // Load some modules load_module("/lib/modules/5.16.0/kernel/drivers/hwmon/tps6518x-hwmon.ko", ""); load_module("/lib/modules/5.16.0/kernel/drivers/regulator/tps6518x-regulator.ko", ""); load_module("/lib/modules/5.16.0/kernel/drivers/video/fbdev/mxc/mxc_epdc_v2_fb.ko", ""); }

andi 1/4/2023 3:35 PM
initrd itself is compressed
3:35 PM
so everything within, too
3:37 PM
you might get advantage on ram usage, if you keep things compressed
3:38 PM
pmOS has ramdisk running
3:38 PM
with epd for crypto unlock
3:39 PM
so the rootfs can be encrypted
3:39 PM
and that also works nicely without such tricks
3:40 PM
disk space: well, we have GBs
3:40 PM
kernel is just loaded as ordinary file, there is some limitation within u-boot I think
3:40 PM
but I would guess that even 32MB would be ok
3:43 PM
it is just a file on a partition
Szybet
we are running low on disk space there, waveshare is next to the kernel annd initrd
andi 1/4/2023 3:49 PM
Reading it a second time: that is the situation with factory u-boot. But said that, I think the lowest disk space we would have if we just highly compress the whole stuff, i.e. CONFIG_KERNEL_XZ=y
andi

// Kobo Clara HD (N249) specific stuff if(strstr(device, "n249")) { // Unsquashing modules { const char * arguments[] = { "/usr/bin/unsquashfs", "-d", "/lib/modules", "/opt/modules.sqsh", NULL }; run_command("/usr/bin/unsquashfs", arguments, true); } // Put epdc.fw in the right place mkpath("/lib/firmware/imx", 0755); { const char * arguments[] = { "/usr/bin/unsquashfs", "-d", "/lib/firmware/imx/epdc", "/opt/firmware.sqsh", NULL }; run_command("/usr/bin/unsquashfs", arguments, true); } // Load some modules load_module("/lib/modules/5.16.0/kernel/drivers/hwmon/tps6518x-hwmon.ko", ""); load_module("/lib/modules/5.16.0/kernel/drivers/regulator/tps6518x-regulator.ko", ""); load_module("/lib/modules/5.16.0/kernel/drivers/video/fbdev/mxc/mxc_epdc_v2_fb.ko", ""); }

alex(O_o) 1/10/2023 9:19 PM
0001-clarahd-port.patch
1.35 KB
1
9:20 PM
to patch inkbox-os-init
9:21 PM
then to compile init use these command
9:21 PM
/home/build/inkbox/kernel/toolchain/armv7l-linux-musleabihf-cross/bin/armv7l-linux-musleabihf-gcc init.c -o init -static -D_GNU_SOURCE
9:21 PM
then
9:22 PM
/home/build/inkbox/kernel/toolchain/armv7l-linux-musleabihf-cross/bin/armv7l-linux-musleabihf-strip init
9:23 PM
then to replace the init
9:24 PM
cp /home/build/inkbox/inkbox-os-init/init /home/build/inkbox/kernel/initrd/common/init
9:24 PM
and build the kernel again

alex(O_o) 1/14/2023 11:40 PM
• patch the kernel with andi1's patches at #patches • git clone then patch inkbox-os-init with my patch • compile inkbox-os-init /home/build/inkbox/kernel/toolchain/armv7l-linux-musleabihf-cross/bin/armv7l-linux-musleabihf-gcc init.c -o init -static -D_GNU_SOURCE /home/build/inkbox/kernel/toolchain/armv7l-linux-musleabihf-cross/bin/armv7l-linux-musleabihf-strip init • copy (overwrite) init to the right place cp /home/build/inkbox/inkbox-os-init/init /home/build/inkbox/kernel/initrd/common/init • compile kernel with the usual command and copy zimage to sdcard • git clone rootfs • build rootfs •copy rootfs to sdcard • root the device echo rooted | dd of=/dev/mmcblk0 bs=512 seek=79872 • Tweak the bootloader to make things work without ext4load and similar anoying commands 1. Create a file named uboot-script.cmd with the following lines in it: led tolinoshine2hd:white:on on setenv bootargs console=ttymxc0,115200 echo Loading kernel load mmc 0:1 0x80800000 zImage echo Loading DTB load mmc 0:1 0x83000000 DTB echo Booting kernel bootz 0x80800000 0x83000000 2. Create a boot.scr file mkimage -A arm -O linux -T script -n postmarketOS -d uboot-script.cmd boot.scr 3. Then put it in the first partition of the sdcard cp boot.scr /path/to/first/part 4. Modify u-boot env Start the device, when u-boot shell is accessible type setenv bootcmd load mmc 0:1 ${loadaddr} /boot.scr \; source ${loadaddr} then save the env with saveenv 5. Reboot
1
11:41 PM
maybe not complete/exact, reading the channel will help understand
alex(O_o)
• patch the kernel with andi1's patches at #patches • git clone then patch inkbox-os-init with my patch • compile inkbox-os-init /home/build/inkbox/kernel/toolchain/armv7l-linux-musleabihf-cross/bin/armv7l-linux-musleabihf-gcc init.c -o init -static -D_GNU_SOURCE /home/build/inkbox/kernel/toolchain/armv7l-linux-musleabihf-cross/bin/armv7l-linux-musleabihf-strip init • copy (overwrite) init to the right place cp /home/build/inkbox/inkbox-os-init/init /home/build/inkbox/kernel/initrd/common/init • compile kernel with the usual command and copy zimage to sdcard • git clone rootfs • build rootfs •copy rootfs to sdcard • root the device echo rooted | dd of=/dev/mmcblk0 bs=512 seek=79872 • Tweak the bootloader to make things work without ext4load and similar anoying commands 1. Create a file named uboot-script.cmd with the following lines in it: led tolinoshine2hd:white:on on setenv bootargs console=ttymxc0,115200 echo Loading kernel load mmc 0:1 0x80800000 zImage echo Loading DTB load mmc 0:1 0x83000000 DTB echo Booting kernel bootz 0x80800000 0x83000000 2. Create a boot.scr file mkimage -A arm -O linux -T script -n postmarketOS -d uboot-script.cmd boot.scr 3. Then put it in the first partition of the sdcard cp boot.scr /path/to/first/part 4. Modify u-boot env Start the device, when u-boot shell is accessible type setenv bootcmd load mmc 0:1 ${loadaddr} /boot.scr \; source ${loadaddr} then save the env with saveenv 5. Reboot

alex(O_o) 1/15/2023 7:47 AM
zImage and DTB are in partition 1 ?
andi 1/15/2023 9:56 AM
bootz 0x80800000 0x83000000 there should be a dash in between
9:57 AM
so bootz 0x80800000 - 0x83000000
andi 1/15/2023 10:04 AM
the logic is bootz <kernel_zImage_addr> <initrd.gz_addr> <dtb_addr> (edited)
10:05 AM
if something is not needed, it is replaced with a dash
2

zImage and DTB are in partition 1 ?

1:14 PM
you can verify if things behave as expected
1:14 PM

tux-linux 3/12/2023 10:45 PM
np
andi 3/12/2023 11:02 PM
just was curios: ^64bit is required for pre 2.6.20 kernels (edited)
11:03 PM
but newer u-boots (if you read files from filesystem)
11:04 PM
definitively the 2009.08 u-boot
andi 3/12/2023 11:13 PM
the 2016.03 factory u-boot found in kobos with 4.1.15 kernel needs that ^64bit too
11:14 PM
just in june in that year, u-boot starts to refuse to access filesystems with that 64bit activated, before is just did nonsene
11:17 PM
... to be just implemented in September of that year
11:18 PM
I am using some 2020.10 u-boot
11:19 PM
that meta_csum is a bit different, the stuff can be ignored if things are just read
11:21 PM
so proper filesystem implementations not supporting that just find: "oh there is something additional I do not understand, but reading is ok"

andi 7/13/2023 4:58 PM

andi 7/13/2023 5:38 PM
Installing the bootloader Write the bootloader on the whole device. dd if=bootloader/out/u-boot_inkbox.n249.imx of=/dev/<microsd> bs=1K seek=1 Create an environment u-boot-env.txt for the bootloader. mkenvimage -p 0 -s 8192 -o u-boot-env.bin u-boot-env.txt dd if=u-boot-env.bin of=/dev/<microsd> bs=4096 seek=192 Formatting the microSD Run the partition script as follows. sudo sfdisk /dev/<microsd> < partition-script.txt
5:38 PM
mount /dev/<microsd>1 /mnt cp kernel/kernel/out/n249/zImage-root /mnt cp kernel/kernel/linux-5.16-n249/arch/arm/boot/dts/imx6sll-kobo-clarahd.dtb /mnt cp boot.scr /mnt
5:38 PM

7:03 PM

7:03 PM

NiLuJe 7/21/2023 7:04 PM
That would imply that the driver has some issues with collision handling, though
7:04 PM
Waiting essentially prevents you from issuing colliding updates
7:05 PM
But it shouldn't be stricly necessary
7:05 PM
We do it to fence full updates to prevent the driver from coalescing stuff in weird ways, but it shouldn't screw up to the extent I saw (edited)
tux-linux 7/21/2023 7:05 PM
oh, then that's why when I click on the brightness slider it is so much slower to change it
7:05 PM
well, any way to partially enable it sometimes?
NiLuJe 7/21/2023 7:05 PM
That's a platform plugin issue
7:06 PM
I don't know how that flag is used
7:06 PM
But ideally it would need to be used with a bit of heuristics instead of blindly everywhere
7:07 PM
c.f., https://github.com/koreader/koreader-base/blob/b0f7e99845b16fc4176d3d29e4ffc258baa53cca/ffi/framebuffer_mxcfb.lua#L243-L389
koreader-base/ffi/framebuffer_mxcfb.lua at b0f7e99845b16fc4176d3d29...
Base framework offering a Lua scriptable environment for creating document readers - koreader/koreader-base
7:07 PM
Basically, around FULL updates should cover most of it
7:07 PM
And if you're actually issuing FULL updates for a slider, that's a you issue (edited)

NiLuJe

andi 8/23/2023 10:46 PM
if [ "${UID_FLAG}" != "1" ]; then echo -n "${UID}" | dd of=/dev/mmcblk0 bs=512 seek=1 exit 0 fi
Szybet 8/23/2023 10:49 PM
?
andi 8/23/2023 10:50 PM
the idea behind gpt was just that on that 128GB sd card I will have more partitions and with dos table I would need to fiddle with extended partions, so there would be no /dev/mmcblk0p4 and I did not want to touch inkbox to change that number
10:50 PM
gpt: you have usually one partition in the mbr, type 0xee spanning the whole disk
10:50 PM
starting on 512
10:51 PM
where then some header is

1:32 AM
https://pl.wikipedia.org/wiki/SquashFS
SquashFS
SquashFS (.sfs) – skompresowany system plików tylko do odczytu, przeznaczony dla systemu operacyjnego Linux i wydany na wolnej licencji. SquashFS kompresuje pliki, i-węzły oraz katalogi. W celu poprawy stopnia kompresji, rozmiar jednostki alokacji został ograniczony do maksymalnie 1024 kB. SquashFS projektowany był z myślą o ogólnym użytku tylko...

andi 11/29/2023 10:26 PM
tried it again
10:27 PM
xzcat clarahd.xz >/dev/sdX
10:27 PM
mkfs.ext4 /dev/sdb4
10:27 PM
mount /dev/sdb4 /mnt
10:27 PM
cd /mnt
10:28 PM
unsquashfs -ig -d . /path/to/p4.sqsh
10:28 PM
cd
10:28 PM
umount /mnt
10:29 PM
sync
10:29 PM
and eject sd and place it into kobo clara
10:30 PM
existing lost+found can be a pitfall when unsquashing
10:30 PM
hence -ig
andi 11/29/2023 10:52 PM

TheLinuxPirate
What is the most powerful device supported (with expandable/removable storage) by Inkbox? I'll admit my interest in the Kobo Clara HD was sparked by the postmarketos port to that device but I'm happy to have found this project which is a bit more "ready to go" and tailored for what I want out of my Kobo. My initial goal is to see about building the latest LTS kernel(s) 6.6/6.1 for my clara hd and going from there.
andi 12/25/2023 9:47 PM
pmOS uses 6.6 at the moment
9:48 PM
I can merge together the fbdev driver variant
9:48 PM
as pmOS uses drm
andi
sleep cover is reported the same way as a laptop cover is
Szybet 12/25/2023 9:50 PM
we rely on old header evdev names for that
andi 12/25/2023 9:50 PM
I know
9:51 PM
the point is that in the long run having the code like
9:53 PM
if (device == some_device) { do_something() } else if(device == some_other_device) { do_something_else() } is hard to maintain
9:54 PM
so I think the better approach is to limit these ifs to odd things
9:55 PM
and SW_LID is here the more standard way (edited)
andi 12/26/2023 1:01 PM
regarding kernels, I regularly update kernels
1:02 PM
for pmOS purposes
1:02 PM
so as soon as inkbox uses submodules for the kernel source
1
1:02 PM
things can be kept up to date easily
1:02 PM
if needed
1
tux-linux
Click to see attachment 🖼️
tux-linux 1/8/2024 11:07 PM
@andi this is what happened before i changed the platform plugin code so that it waited for every refresh
andi

NiLuJe 2/12/2024 8:31 PM
Because that doesn't apply to the Clara HD (and hopefully doesn't apply at all anywhere on mainline kernels)
8:32 PM
Even if it did, that's not how the issue related to that flag manifests (edited)
8:32 PM
(which, for reference, is the WAIT_FOR_UPDATE_COMPLETE ioctl throwing a timeout on perfectly valid use-cases. See the virtual keyboard in Nickel when entering a WiFi password for example.) (edited)
8:33 PM
Applies to a bunch of imx6sll devices (libra/nia/libra 2/clara 2e) (edited)

NiLuJe 3/16/2024 4:25 PM
And, yeah, the bitdepth question was a good one. I would assume 32bpp, because Qt5 still doesn't think Y8 is a first-class QPainter citizen, so I don't think InkBox would ever be running at 8bpp
4:25 PM
(sadly)
4:25 PM
Same reason why Nickel runs at 32bpp
4:26 PM
So, also do that at the same bitdepth the issues are reproduced (because I know for a fact than on vendor kernels, the Clara is especially finicky at 8bpp)
4:26 PM
(technically, at 8bpp + rota 0)
4:27 PM
(which isn't the native Portrait, so that's less of a problem than it could have been)

4:53 PM
